title: Tech Down as Trade Tensions Rise, Tariffs Kick In — Tech Roundup
text:
The technology sector fell as trade tensions between the U.S. and China rose again.

Recent data from the Semiconductor Industry Association paints a bleak picture for U.S. chip makers, according to one brokerage. "We remain deep in a semiconductor downturn, with total semiconductor sales decreasing 15% year-over-year in July," the third straight month of declines of a similar magnitude, said analysts at brokerage Nomura Securities, in a research note.

The latest round of tariffs affecting tech goods imported from China could have a further deleterious impact on the semiconductor business, the Nomura analysts warned.
